channel.title: Link Rot
channel.itunes:subtitle: A discussion about the intersection of life & technology.
channel.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
channel.itunes:summary: Link Rot is a show about the intersection of life and technology. Each week we dive into a subject that explores changes in digital technology and the way it affects our lives. We discuss how technology impacts our very humanity and have fun along the way!
channel.description: Link Rot is a show about the intersection of life and technology. Each week we dive into a subject that explores changes in digital technology and the way it affects our lives. We discuss how technology impacts our very humanity and have fun along the way!
channel.webMaster: info@linkrot.net (Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson)

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson

item.title: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:summary: The power of TV has been dwindling over recent years. So will the experience of Netflix kill off TV?
item.description: Episode 3 and we ask the question - will Netflix kill TV?

item.title: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:summary: More and more of our lives are becoming digitised - digital objects without a physical equivalent or presence. What kind of effect does this have on us - our identity and how we navigate our history?
item.description: Episode 2 and we asking what happens when physical stuff is replaced by the digital.
item.itunes:keywords: Stuff, Physical Objects, DVDs, Photos, Identity

item.title: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:summary: Join Tim, Ben and Adam for this, the first episode, as we discuss some of the things passing us by at the intersection of life and technology.
item.description: Our first episode and we tackle just how boring new technology is and what death looks like in the digital age.
